channel.title: mycatalog updates
channel.description: 'My Catalog' uses the IBM Cloud catalog API to retrieve data from the catalog. It attempts to be as accurate as possible. This feed shows additions, updates, removals from the catalog. Use with care. It is a work-in-progress :)

item.title: [updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) is the new name of Knowledge Catalog
[updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) is no longer marked with hipaa
[updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) has a new plan named essentials
item.description: The Essentials plan includes core capabilities to automatically discover, profile, enrich, analyze data lineage and quality, and share data products as you begin to establish a data-centric organization.

item.title: [updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) has a new plan named premium
item.description: The Premium plan provides a comprehensive set of tools for advanced data discovery, cataloging, governance, quality, lineage and data product hub, augmented by Gen AI. Access to IBM Knowledge Accelerators is also included.

item.title: [updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) has a new plan named standard-v3
item.description: The Standard plan includes advanced capabilities in data governance, quality, lineage and data product hub. Access to IBM Knowledge Accelerators is also included.

item.title: [updated] watsonx.data intelligence (datacatalog) has a new plan named trial
item.description:
This plan provides you with a free 30-day trial of watsonx.data intelligence to explore the full set of integrated and AI-powered capabilities to deliver trusted data to support your business and AI initiatives.
**Trial plan services, including all data and assets, are deleted after 30 days.**

item.title: [updated] Red Hat AI InstructLab (instructlab) is the new name of InstructLab
[removed] Skytap On IBM Cloud (skytap)
item.description: Skytap is a cloud service designed specifically to natively run AIX, Linux and IBM i on POWER and x86, Windows and Linux traditional enterprise applications.
